Name: Duchy of Tamarind-Abbey
Description: The Duchy of Tamarind was originally a province of the Free Worlds League. It seceded from the League during the Word of Blake Jihad, and would later combine with the Abbey District to form the Duchy of Tamarind-Abbey, an independent state.
ReputationStatements: I don't know why we bother offering you contracts, to be perfectly honest. It's obvious you're not a friend to the Duchy of Tamarind-Abbey. Regardless, we find ourselves in desperate times, so we have to scrape the bottom of the barrel.
Greetings, mercenary. Lowly and despicable though you may be, you may yet serve our interests. Finish this job, and we may look upon you with more favor than you likely deserve.
The Duchy of Tamarind-Abbey has a use for mercenaries like you, Commander. I think you'll be interested in the attached contract. Hopefully we can come to a mutually beneficial agreement.
The Duchy of Tamarind-Abbey would like to offer you a choice contract, Commander. As the leader of a respected mercenary company, you should find the terms both fair and equitable, I think.
Commander, I hope this message finds you well. The people of the Duchy of Tamarind-Abbey would like to extend a contract to you, owing to our respect for your skills. Please consider it carefully.

Greetings, my friend. This contract is not one we would offer to a lesser mercenary, but you've proven your loyalty, prowess, and dedication to the ideals of the Free Worlds League. I hope you'll accept our offer.

We both know the score, Commander. House Marik relies on you like you're one of our own, and you've always been happy to help us out. I hope you can see fit to agree this time as well—this is a job too important for lesser warriors.
MissionSuccessStatements: Top-tier work, Commander—The Duchy is very happy with your performance. Keep it up, and I'll make sure a lot more work comes your way.
GoodFaithFailureStatements: The Duchy of Tamarind-Abbey understands that sacrifice on the battlefield doesn't always translate to victory. You've made a fine effort, even if it failed. Just another lesson for the next battle.
BadFaithFailureStatements: We are deeply disappointed in your performance, Commander. Your efforts on the battlefield were those of a raw cadet, not the leader of a mercenary company.
